title: Srimad Bhgavatam 2.9.33 Lecture-1 by HG Stoka Krihna Prabhu
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Brahma, it is I, the personality of Godhead, who was existing before the creation, when there was nothing but myself.
segments.summary: The speaker repeats a verse emphasizing the existence of the Personality of Godhead before, during, and after creation.

segments.key_quote: Therefore, there is a difference between the two Is, namely the Predominator I and the Predominated I.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the impersonalist view of oneness and refutes it by highlighting the difference between the creator (Vishnu) and the created (Brahma).

segments.key_quote: So remember these four questions because that will give a lot of clarity as to what is it that Vishnu is trying to answer.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the four questions asked by Brahma and explains that these questions are answered in the four verses of the Yatushloki Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: The essence of the Bhagavatam was spoken by Vishnu to Brahma in these four verses.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the essence of the Bhagavatam was spoken by Vishnu to Brahma in four verses, emphasizing the importance of hearing to realize the Absolute Truth.

segments.key_quote: Our false ego is the filter that is actually coming in the way of our proper hearing.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of hearing properly from the right source, emphasizing the role of Sadhana Bhakti in purifying consciousness and clearing false ego.

segments.key_quote: Hear about Krishna from the Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how the hearing process, when properly applied, purifies consciousness, breaks the knot of material existence, and terminates the chain of action and reaction.

segments.key_quote: It is the person in Godhead, Vishnu himself who was existing before the creation when there was nothing but himself.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes Vishnu's existence before creation, even before material nature, highlighting that He exists beyond cause and effect.

segments.key_quote: That which you see now is also I the personality of God.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Vishnu remains present during and after creation, addressing the Mayavadi argument that Brahma is the same identical 'I' as the Absolute Truth.

segments.key_quote: So there are two distinct I's here, the creator and the creator itself the creator and the created
segments.summary: The speaker refutes the idea that Brahma and Vishnu are identical, emphasizing the distinction between the creator and the created, the predominator and the predominated.

The speaker uses the Kathopanishad to explain the similarity and difference between Brahma and Vishnu, highlighting that while both are eternal and conscious, Vishnu is the one maintainer of the many living entities.

segments.key_quote: He displayed renunciation of the highest order.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to discuss Gautam Shraddha Babaji Maharaj and Jagannath Das Babaji Maharaj, highlighting their renunciation and their place in the parampara.

segments.key_quote: He is totally disinterested in any sense gratification.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the extremely simple and renounced lifestyle of Jagannath Das Babaji Maharaj, emphasizing his disinterest in sense gratification.

segments.key_quote: Still all the conclusions of the Shastras of the Krishna Consciousness philosophy was always illuminated in his heart.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Gaurav Vishwanath Babaji Maharaj's absorption in Hari Bhajana, his illiteracy, and how the conclusions of the Shastras were illuminated in his heart.

segments.key_quote: He would not so much be interested in giving such benediction for material advancement.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Gaurav Vishwanath Babaji Maharaj's disinterest in material benefits and recounts the story of Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur seeking Diksha from God Kishodad Babaji Maharaj.

segments.key_quote: So when Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur heard this reply, he became very very unhappy.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story of Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur receiving Diksha, emphasizing his devotion and the compassion of God Kishodad Babaji Maharaj.

segments.key_quote: Then the Lord enlightens the devotee from within.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Gaurav Krishna and Bhavani Maharaj was enlightened from within and could easily recognize imposter devotees.

segments.key_quote: So, we pray to him that by his mercy, we may develop renunciation and we may get enlightenment in Krishna consciousness.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the discussion of Gaurav Krishna and Bhavani Maharaj, highlighting his renunciation and the mood of separation from Krishna (Vipralambara Sampode).
